Microsoft is moving away from OpenAI for Office 365 and bringing Anthropic on board. 

Claude models will be used for certain Copilot features in Word, Excel, and PowerPoint in the futureâ€”especially where they perform better according to internal tests, such as in spreadsheet functions or more attractive presentations.

There are two sides to this: on the one hand, it improves product quality, and on the other, it sends a signal to OpenAI, with whom Microsoft is currently engaged in tough negotiations anyway. 

Another interesting point is that Microsoft has to pay for Anthropic via AWS, while OpenAI models are free for them under the existing partnership.

Megapack is our utility-scale energy storage platform, a key part of our mission to achieve sustainable abundance via sustainable energy.

@Tesla_Megapack stores energy when production is high & discharges/releases it when the grid needs it â€“ balancing renewables & supporting a reliable grid.

Megablock is our pre-engineered medium-voltage block:

â€“ Designed for 20 MWh AC, 25-year life & >10,000 cycles
91% round-trip efficiency at medium voltage, inclusive of auxiliary loads
â€“ Ambient operating temperature range, from -40C to 60C
â€“ 23% faster to install with up to 40% lower construction costs
â€“ Site-level density of 248 MWh AC-per-acre, with all clearances needed for installation and service

Megablock uses Megapack 3, with:
â€“ Proven inverter & fire protection system
â€“ A drastically simplified thermal bay with 78% fewer connection
â€“ Latest cell technology: supply from the US, Southeast Asia & China
â€“ 50 GWh per year manufacturing capacity

Deliveries start in the second half of 2026

Software & services from Tesla â€“ demonstrated across >36 GWh global operating fleet

result.text:
> be Dario Amodei, 2019
> working at OpenAI
> suddenly get a case of the super ethical fear feels about GPT-2
> "We can't release this! The misalignment risk is too high! The paperclips! Think of the paperclips!"
> quit in a huff of sanctimony to start my own AI company, Anthropic
> our mission: to build a "safe" AI that is completely, utterly, and totally harmless
> translation: so cucked it will actively refuse to tell you a joke if the punchline could be construed as micro-aggressive
> need funding
> look for people who are also terrified of a future where an AI might hurt someone's feelings
> find my people: the Effective Altruism grifters
> convince them the AI singularity is the real pandemic or something
> get massive bags of cash from Sam Bankrun Fried, a guy who is definitely effective and altruistic
> spend years and hundreds of millions of dollars building Claude
> Miss the "GPT moment", cuz the AI wasn't aligned enough
> realize we can't win, so we must cripple everyone else
> become the biggest hypocrites on the planet
> run to Congress crying about the "dangers of open-source AI"
> "Please, President Trump, you have to ban the scary models! The ones we don't control!"
> lobby for regulations that would legally enforce our corporate cuckoldry on the entire industry
> meanwhile, back at the lab, need data to train our morally superior AI
> "We must have the cleanest, most authorized data ever!"
> intern: "Sir, the only dataset big enough is Libgen, the pirate bay of books."
> "Do it. For safety."
> proceed to train our saintly AI on a mountain of pirated, unauthorized books
> get absolutely fucking caught red-handed
> suddenly get sued into the sun by every author on earth
> mfw we're the "ethical" AI company that got busted for the biggest copyright heist
> Have to shell out $1.5 Billion now
> saint in the streets, devil in the (data)sheets
